message_1: What is the balanced chemical equation for the combustion of methane (CH4) in the presence of oxygen (O2)? What is the theoretical yield of carbon dioxide (CO2) if 10 moles of methane are combusted completely?
message_2:
The balanced chemical equation for the combustion of methane (CH4) in the presence of oxygen (O2) is:

CH4 + 2O2 â†’ CO2 + 2H2O

If 10 moles of methane are combusted completely, the theoretical yield of carbon dioxide (CO2) can be calculated using the stoichiometry of the balanced equation. Since there is a 1:1 ratio between methane and carbon dioxide, the theoretical yield of CO2 will be the same as the moles of methane.

Therefore, the theoretical yield of CO2 is 10 moles.
